conclusion: To determine heat absorption or release from A to B, analyze the P-V diagram.
Process A→B is isothermal, meaning constant temperature.
In an isothermal process for an ideal gas, internal energy remains constant.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Since ΔU = 0, Q = W for isothermal process.
Work done by gas during expansion A→B is area under curve.
Work done (W) is positive as gas expands.
Since W > 0, Q must also be positive.
Positive Q indicates heat is absorbed by gas from surroundings.
The gas absorbs heat when moving from state A to state B.
